question: Who authored the book PMO: Prime Minister’s Office Through the Years, focusing on the evolution of India's top administrative office?
solution:
The book PMO: Prime Minister’s Office Through the Years is written by Himanshu Roy, a Political Science Professor at JNU. It traces the development of the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) since independence, highlighting its role as the executive’s decision-making hub.

  • The book examines key Prime Ministers—from Nehru to Modi—and their influence on PMO's structure.
  • It offers insights into administrative shifts and political power.
  • Useful for civil service aspirants and those interested in Indian governance.
  • Himanshu Roy is known for his deep scholarship on Indian political institutions.

question: Who authored the book India@2047: Leading the Global Economic Order, which outlines India’s roadmap to becoming a global economic superpower?
solution:
The book India@2047: Leading the Global Economic Order is authored by Dr. SP Sharma, a renowned economist and Chief Economist at Neo Economists.

  • It presents a strategic blueprint for India’s transformation into a developed economy by 2047, the centenary of independence.
  • The book highlights key reforms, Make in India, Digital India, and PM Gati Shakti, along with India’s rising global trade and FDI.
  • It envisions a future with USD 35 trillion GDP, USD 21,000 per capita income, and leadership in AI, green energy, and digital infrastructure.
  • Dr. Sharma has over 27 years of experience in policy advocacy and economic research.

question: Who authored the book Indira Gandhi and the Years that Transformed India, which explores the political legacy of India’s first woman Prime Minister?
solution:
Indira Gandhi and the Years that Transformed India is written by Srinath Raghavan, a historian and professor at Ashoka University.

  • The book covers Indira Gandhi’s tenure from 1966 to 1984, including the Emergency, bank nationalization, and nuclear testing.
  • Raghavan introduces the concept of “Caesarist” leadership, where popular support overrides institutional checks.
  • It’s based on 15 years of research and newly declassified files.
  • The book is praised for its balanced analysis and is essential for understanding modern Indian democracy.

question: Who released the PMAY-U Coffee Table Book Transforming Lives: A Glance of PMAY (Urban) Mission in Nagaland?
solution:
The PMAY-U Coffee Table Book titled Transforming Lives was released by Zhaleo Rio, Retired IAS officer and Advisor for Urban Development in Nagaland.

  • It documents the success of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Urban (PMAY-U) in Nagaland, especially in 32 statutory towns.
  • The book showcases beneficiary stories, housing progress, and urban transformation.
  • PMAY-U, launched in 2015, aims for “Housing for All” and has achieved 93% completion in Nagaland.
  • The book serves as a visual record of inclusive urban growth and policy impact.

question: Who authored the autobiography Janta Ki Kahani – Meri Aatmkatha, recently released by Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar?
solution:
Janta Ki Kahani – Meri Aatmkatha is the autobiography of Bandaru Dattatraya, the Governor of Haryana and former Union Minister of Labour and Employment.

  • Released on May 9, 2025, by Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar, the book chronicles his personal, political, and social journey.
  • It reflects his commitment to public service, especially in slum development, disaster relief, and voluntary work.
  • Dattatraya credits his mother Eshwaramma ji for inspiring his life of service.
  • The book is described as a “living document” and a source of inspiration for future generations.

question: Who authored the book Ramanujan: Journey of a Great Mathematician, launched by the National Archives of India in April 2025?
option_1: Srinath Raghavan & Devendra Kumar Sharma
option_2: Arun Singhal & Devendra Kumar Sharma
option_3: Himanshu Roy & Devendra Kumar Sharma
option_4: Dr. SP Sharma & Devendra Kumar Sharma
solution:
Ramanujan: Journey of a Great Mathematician is co-authored by Arun Singhal and Dr. Devendra Kumar Sharma, and was launched on April 30, 2025 by the National Archives of India in collaboration with Vani Prakashan.

  • The book explores the life and legacy of Srinivasa Ramanujan, one of India’s greatest mathematicians.
  • It highlights his work in number theory, infinite series, and continued fractions, despite having no formal training in mathematics.
  • The book includes rare letters and documents, especially his correspondence with G.H. Hardy, who helped bring Ramanujan’s work to global attention.
  • Ramanujan’s journey from Erode, Tamil Nadu, to Cambridge is portrayed as a story of genius, perseverance, and mentorship.

question: Who authored the book The Chief Minister and the Spy: An Unlikely Friendship, which explores the complex relationship between a Kashmiri leader and India’s top intelligence officer?
solution:
The Chief Minister and the Spy is written by Amarjit Singh Dulat, former RAW chief and Special Advisor on Kashmir in PMO under Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

  • The book, published in April 2025, explores his unusual friendship with Farooq Abdullah, former Chief Minister of Jammu & Kashmir.
  • It covers key events like the IC-814 hijacking, abrogation of Article 370, and Kashmir’s political shifts.
  • Dulat offers an insider’s view into India’s intelligence operations, Kashmir’s turbulent history, and Abdullah’s personal and political dilemmas.
  • The book sparked debate for its revelations on Abdullah’s private stance on Article 370.
  • Dulat has authored several acclaimed works including Kashmir: The Vajpayee Years and The Spy Chronicles.

question: Who authored the book The Great Conciliator: Lal Bahadur Shastri and the Transformation of India, which reassesses the legacy of India’s second Prime Minister?
solution:
The Great Conciliator is written by Sanjeev Chopra, a historian and former IAS officer, published by Bloomsbury India in March 2025.

  • The book explores Lal Bahadur Shastri’s leadership, from his humble beginnings in Mughalsarai to his tenure as India’s second Prime Minister.
  • It highlights his role in the formation of BSF, Green Revolution, and the iconic slogan “Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan”.
  • Chopra portrays Shastri as a consensus-builder, who preferred negotiation over confrontation, making him a model of integrity and pragmatism.
  • The book also covers his handling of the 1965 Indo-Pak war, and his moral resignation as Railway Minister, setting a benchmark for public accountability.
  • Sanjeev Chopra served as Director of the Lal Bahadur Shastri Academy and brings deep insight into Shastri’s administrative legacy.

question: Who authored the autobiography The India I Saw: A Glimpse into the Life of S. Ambujammal, originally written in Tamil and translated into English?
solution:
The India I Saw is the autobiography of S. Ambujammal (1899–1981), a freedom fighter, social reformer, and Gandhian activist.

  • Originally written in Tamil as Naan Kanda Bharatham in 1973, it was translated into English by Sriram V. and published in January 2025 by Rupa Publications.
  • The book offers a firsthand account of life in Madras (Chennai) during the freedom struggle, highlighting women’s sacrifices, colonial challenges, and social reform.
  • Ambujammal was the daughter of S. Srinivasa Iyengar, a top lawyer and Congress leader, and she founded the Srinivasa Gandhi Nilayam in 1948 for women’s welfare.
  • She was awarded the Padma Shri for her contributions to society.
  • This autobiography is a rare subaltern perspective on India’s transformation.

question: What is the title of the book that compiles 34 speeches by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Indian culture, traditions, and heritage?
option_1: The Fifth Pillar of Democracy
option_2: Sanskriti Ka Paanchva Adhyay
option_3: Bharat Ki Sanskritik Yatra
solution:
Sanskriti Ka Paanchva Adhyay is a curated compilation of 34 speeches by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, delivered between 2015 and 2024, focusing on Indian culture, traditions, and spiritual heritage.

  • The book was launched on April 18, 2025, at IGNCA, New Delhi, coinciding with World Heritage Day.
  • It includes speeches on Kedarnath redevelopment, Kashi Vishwanath Dham, Global Buddhist Conference, and Bhagavad Gita editions.
  • The compilation is edited by Dr. Prabhat Ojha, with a foreword by Ram Bahadur Rai, and published by Prabhat Prakashan.
  • It reflects Modi’s vision of “Virasat bhi, Vikas bhi”—heritage along with development.

question: Who authored the book Leo – The Untold Story, which chronicles the journey of Chennai Super Kings in the IPL?
solution:
Leo – The Untold Story is written by PS Raman, a senior advocate and former Vice-President of the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA).

  • Launched in March 2025, the book offers a behind-the-scenes account of CSK’s rise, including its two-year suspension, legal battles, and comeback.
  • It features exclusive photos, anecdotes, and insights into CSK’s management and fan culture.
  • The launch event was attended by MS Dhoni, R. Ashwin, and other CSK legends.
  • A must-read for IPL fans, especially those who admire MS Dhoni’s leadership.

question: Which ministry released the book Ripples of Change: Gender-Transformative Rural WASH Programs in India, highlighting women-led sanitation success stories?
option_2: Ministry of Rural Development
option_3: Ministry of Women & Child Development
option_4: Ministry of Jal Shakti
solution:
Ripples of Change was released by the Ministry of Jal Shakti in collaboration with UNICEF India on March 26, 2025, in New Delhi.

  • It features 10 case studies showcasing women’s leadership in WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene) initiatives.
  • The book highlights the impact of Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) and Jal Jeevan Mission through a gender-transformative lens.
  • Launched by Union Minister CR Patil, it emphasizes that “when women lead, change follows”.
  • It’s a powerful documentation of grassroots innovation and Empowerment.

question: Who authored the book To the Seventh Generation, chronicling the legacy of Christian Medical College (CMC) Vellore?
solution:
To the Seventh Generation is written by Dr. VI Mathan, former Director of CMC Vellore, and launched in March 2025.

  • The book traces CMC’s journey from a missionary hospital to a prestigious medical institution.
  • It includes insights from Ida Scudder, CMC’s founder, and reflects 70+ years of experience by Dr. Mathan as student, teacher, and administrator.
  • The book emphasizes ethical medical practice, education, and community service.
  • It’s a tribute to CMC’s four pillars: students, patients, staff, and association.

question: Who authored the book Guardian of Heritage, a biography celebrating Vietnamese artist Dr Chu Bao Que’s cultural legacy?
solution:
Guardian of Heritage is authored by Dr. Biswaroop Roy Chowdhury, a bestselling writer and Chief Editor of India Book of Records.

  • The book is a biography of Dr Chu Bao Que, a Vietnamese artist known for preserving Quan Ho folk singing and promoting Indo-Vietnam cultural ties.
  • Launched in February 2025 at Triveni Kala Sangam, New Delhi, it highlights Dr Que’s efforts in reviving ancient traditions and fostering cross-cultural exchange.
  • Published by Diamond Books, it marks Chowdhury’s first biography, after writing 50+ books on health and memory.
  • The book is part of the Indo-Vietnam Cultural Exchange Programme and showcases the power of art in heritage preservation.

question: Who authored the book I Am?, a spiritual anthology launched by Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar in February 2025?
solution:
I Am? is compiled by Gopichand P. Hinduja, Chairman of the Hinduja Group, and launched on February 8, 2025, at the Vice President Enclave.

  • The book explores spiritual unity, Sanatan values, and the journey from “I” to “We”, promoting Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam.
  • It features reflections from global leaders, including King Charles III and Sheikh Nahyan bin Mubarak Al Nahyan.
  • Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar praised it as a guide for tolerance and self-awareness.
  • The book blends interfaith wisdom with Bharatiyata, making it relevant for youth navigating a globalized world.

question: Who authored the book The New Icon: Savarkar and the Facts, offering a critical analysis of Savarkar’s legacy?
solution:
The New Icon: Savarkar and the Facts is written by Arun Shourie, a veteran journalist, author, and former Union Minister.

  • Published in January 2025 by Penguin Viking, the book critically examines Vinayak Damodar Savarkar’s life, ideology, and political legacy.
  • Shourie explores topics like mercy petitions, Savarkar’s views on caste, and his relationship with Gandhi and Subhas Bose.
  • The book challenges myths and glorifications, using British archives and Savarkar’s own writings.
  • It’s a well-cited, analytical work that invites readers to reassess Savarkar’s role in Indian history.

question: Who authored the book Poonam Vaani, a heartfelt collection of poetry and reflections on life and personal growth?
solution:
Poonam Vaani is written by Poonam Kalra, a motivational speaker, counsellor, poet, and author.

  • It is her fourth book, launched on February 2, 2025, at Hyatt Centric, New Delhi.
  • The book is a collection of poems and thoughts that reflect her deep understanding of emotions, relationships, and personal transformation.
  • Bollywood actor Manoj Bakshi attended the launch, adding charm to the event.
  • Kalra describes the book as a piece of her heart, aimed at inspiring readers through introspection and poetic wisdom.

question: Who authored the book Life on Mars: Collected Stories, which blends mythology and modern relationships through short fiction?
solution:
Life on Mars: Collected Stories is written by Namita Gokhale, a renowned author and co-founder of the Jaipur Literature Festival.

  • Published in January 2025 by Speaking Tiger, the book contains 15 short stories divided into two sections:
    • Love and Other Derangements
    • The Mirror of the Mahabharata
  • It explores themes of love, fate, mythology, and human emotions, with stories featuring Kunti, Gandhari, and Nala-Damayanti.
  • Gokhale blends contemporary storytelling with mythological depth, making this a literary comeback that reflects her evolving voice.

question: Who authored the autobiography Diyaslai, which chronicles a lifelong fight against child exploitation?
solution:
Diyaslai is the autobiography of Kailash Satyarthi, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and child rights activist.

  • Launched in March 2025 at IGNCA, New Delhi, the book narrates his journey from Vidisha to the global stage.
  • It covers his work with Bachpan Bachao Andolan, Global March Against Child Labour, and his fight against trafficking and slavery.
  • Satyarthi shares personal stories, including his decision to drop his caste surname and his near-death experiences during rescue missions.
  • The book is a call to compassion, urging readers to become sparks of change.

question: Who authored the memoir I Am a Soldier’s Wife: The Life and Love of Toni Lidder, a tribute to Brigadier LS Lidder’s legacy?
solution:
I Am a Soldier’s Wife: The Life and Love of Toni Lidder is written by Geetika Lidder, wife of Brigadier LS Lidder, who tragically lost his life in the 2021 Coonoor helicopter crash.

  • The book, launched in February 2025 by Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi, is a heartfelt memoir that blends love, grief, and resilience.
  • It offers a rare glimpse into the life of an army wife, highlighting emotional strength, sacrifice, and the realities of military families.
  • Brigadier Lidder was known for his leadership, empathy, and intellect, and the book immortalizes his legacy through personal anecdotes and reflections.
  • Geetika, a fourth-generation member of the armed forces, shares her journey with honesty and grace.

question: Who authored the book How India Scaled Mt G20: The Inside Story of the G20 Presidency, offering a behind-the-scenes account of India’s global leadership?
solution:
How India Scaled Mt G20 is written by Amitabh Kant, India’s G20 Sherpa and former CEO of NITI Aayog.

  • Published in January 2025 by Rupa Publications, the book details India’s strategic diplomacy, consensus-building, and negotiation tactics during its G20 presidency.
  • It highlights the creation of the New Delhi Leaders’ Declaration, inclusion of the African Union, and India’s role in resolving geopolitical tensions.
  • The book includes a foreword by Dr. S. Jaishankar, and showcases India’s vision of “One Earth, One Family, One Future”.
  • Kant’s account reflects 300+ hours of negotiations, making it a masterclass in global governance.

question: Who authored the memoir On That Note: Memories of a Life in Music, reflecting on a life immersed in Carnatic music?
solution:
On That Note is written by Sanjay Subrahmanyan, a Sangita Kalanidhi awardee and legendary Carnatic vocalist, co-authored with Krupa Ge.

  • Published in December 2024 by Westland, the book offers a candid look at his musical evolution, personal struggles, and creative breakthroughs.
  • It explores his journey from rigid tradition to experimentation, including his Tamil repertoire, collaborations, and reflections on voice and identity.
  • The memoir is praised for its honesty, depth, and insight into the Carnatic music world.
  • It’s a rare glimpse into the life of a modern maestro.

question: Who authored the essay collection Wild Fictions, exploring climate change, colonialism, and storytelling?
solution:
Wild Fictions is written by Amitav Ghosh, a Jnanpith awardee and acclaimed author known for blending history, ecology, and literature.

  • Published in January 2025 by Fourth Estate India, the book compiles essays from 25 years on language, climate, migration, and imperialism.
  • It includes reflections on Bonbibi legends, Indigenous knowledge, and critiques of “untouched nature” myths.
  • Ghosh challenges colonial narratives and urges readers to rethink human-nature relationships.
  • The book is praised for its intellectual depth, moral urgency, and literary elegance.

question: Who authored the book The World After Gaza, a powerful reflection on the moral and geopolitical crisis surrounding the Gaza conflict?
solution:
The World After Gaza is written by Pankaj Mishra, a globally respected public intellectual and author of Age of Anger.

  • Published in February 2025 by Fern Press, the book offers a moral reckoning with the Gaza war and its historical roots.
  • Mishra contrasts the Western narrative of Holocaust memory with the Global South’s legacy of colonialism and dehumanization.
  • He critiques the justification of violence, explores racial hierarchies, and urges a new global consciousness.
  • The book is praised by thinkers like Naomi Klein, William Dalrymple, and Hisham Matar for its ethical clarity and intellectual depth.
  • It’s considered an indispensable guide to understanding the fractured world order.

question: Who authored the book Parliament: Powers, Functions & Privileges; A Comparative Constitutional Perspective, offering deep insights into India’s legislative framework?
solution:
Parliament: Powers, Functions & Privileges is authored by Dr. KS Chauhan, a constitutional expert and senior advocate.

  • Released in January 2025 by Mohan Law House, the book is a two-volume treatise on India’s Parliament.
  • It covers legislative powers, committee functions, and parliamentary privileges, with comparative insights from UK, USA, and EU systems.
  • Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar launched the book, praising its academic rigor and relevance.
  • It includes chapters on anti-defection law, basic structure doctrine, and judicial review of privileges.
  • A valuable resource for lawmakers, students, and researchers in constitutional law.

question: Who authored the book Chhaunk: On Food, Economics and Society, which blends culinary memories with social science insights?
solution:
Chhaunk: On Food, Economics and Society is written by Abhijit Banerjee, Nobel laureate in Economics (2019).

  • The book is a collection of essays that connect food, economics, and Indian society, using dishes like shami kebab and ghanto to explore themes like savings and women’s liberation.
  • It’s part memoir, part cookbook, and includes 50+ recipes alongside sociological reflections.
  • Banerjee’s writing is light in style but rich in ideas, making it a literary chhaunk—a flavorful sprinkle of thought.
  • Illustrated by Cheyenne Olivier, the book was published by Juggernaut in November 2024.

question: Who authored the autobiography In Pursuit of Democracy: Beyond Party Lines, chronicling four decades of Indian political history?
solution:
In Pursuit of Democracy is written by Dr. Najma Heptulla, a veteran parliamentarian, former Deputy Chairperson of Rajya Sabha, and Governor of Manipur.

  • Published in November 2024 by Rupa Publications, the book offers a ringside view of Indian democracy, from Indira Gandhi to Narendra Modi.
  • It blends personal stories with political milestones, including her transition from Congress to BJP.
  • Heptulla reflects on women’s empowerment, minority rights, and diplomatic roles, making it a living document of history.

question: Who authored the memoir Bring It On: The Incredible Story of My Life, recounting a journey of resilience and triumph?
solution:
Bring It On is written by Dr. Deepa Malik, India’s first female Paralympic medalist, published by HarperCollins India in January 2025.

  • The memoir recounts her battle with spinal tumors, her wheelchair-liberated identity, and her rise as a para-athlete, biker, and rallyist.
  • She has won 23 international medals, and received the Padma Shri, Khel Ratna, and Arjuna Award.
  • The book is a manifesto of courage, breaking stereotypes and inspiring readers to redefine “impossible”.

question: Who authored the book New Bharat – Modi’s Vision and Development 2019–2024, analyzing key events and policies of the Modi government?
solution:
New Bharat – Modi’s Vision and Development 2019–2024 is written by Ravi Parashar, along with Dr. Shabeena Shaikh and Dr. Keshav Patel, and published by Kitabwale in December 2024.

  • The book compiles articles from News18 covering Modi’s foreign visits, COVID-19 response, farm laws, and West Bengal elections.
  • It offers a chronological analysis of events shaping public opinion on Modi’s governance.
  • Launched by Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, it’s a comprehensive reflection on India’s development trajectory.

question: Who authored the book Dalai Lama’s Secret to Happiness, which explores the spiritual teachings of His Holiness the Dalai Lama?
solution:
Dalai Lama’s Secret to Happiness is written by Dr. Dinesh Shahra, an industrialist, philanthropist, and author.

  • Launched on December 12, 2024, at the Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamshala, the book reflects the Dalai Lama’s teachings on compassion, joy, and inner peace.
  • It emphasizes oneness, mindfulness, and loving-kindness, and is part of Shahra’s mission to promote Sanatan values.
  • All proceeds from the book are donated to the Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, supporting Tibetan cultural preservation.
  • Dr. Shahra is also known for his Sanatan Living series and his work in agricultural transformation.

question: Who authored the autobiography Stumped: Life Behind and Beyond the Twenty-two Yards, recounting India’s 1983 World Cup triumph?
solution:
Stumped is the autobiography of Syed Kirmani, India’s legendary wicketkeeper and 1983 World Cup winner, co-authored with Debashish Sengupta and Dakshesh Pathak.

  • Published by Penguin Play in December 2024, the book shares his journey from gully cricket in Bengaluru to global glory.
  • It includes his iconic 126-run partnership with Kapil Dev against Zimbabwe and candid reflections on post-retirement struggles.
  • Kirmani was awarded the Col CK Nayudu Lifetime Achievement Award and holds multiple world records.
  • The book blends humor, honesty, and cricketing insight, making it a must-read for sports lovers.

question: Who authored the book The Unyielding Judge: A Tribute to Justice A.N. Grover’s Legacy, chronicling his role in India’s constitutional history?
solution:
The Unyielding Judge is written by Gauri Grover, a Delhi High Court lawyer and granddaughter of Justice A.N. Grover.

  • Published by OakBridge in December 2024, the book explores Justice Grover’s role in the Kesavananda Bharti case, which upheld the Basic Structure Doctrine.
  • It also covers his work as Chairman of the DPS Society and Press Council of India, reflecting his impact beyond the courtroom.
  • The book is a personal tribute, blending legal insight with heartfelt storytelling.
  • Attorney General R. Venkataramani praised the book for highlighting judicial integrity and constitutional values.

question: Who authored the novel My Beloved Life, which traces the arc of a man’s life across modern Indian history?
solution:
My Beloved Life is written by Amitava Kumar, a novelist, journalist, and professor at Vassar College.

  • Published in May 2024 by Picador, the novel follows Jadunath Kunwar, a historian whose life spans from Gandhi’s death to Modi’s rise.
  • It explores themes of migration, memory, and storytelling, blending personal and national histories.
  • The narrative shifts between Jadu’s life and his daughter Jugnu’s perspective, offering a multi-generational lens.
  • Praised by Salman Rushdie and James Wood, the book is considered Kumar’s finest work to date.

question: Who authored the biography Beyond the Higgs Boson, chronicling Dr. Ashutosh Kotwal’s journey in particle physics?
solution:
Beyond the Higgs Boson is written by Manik Kotwal, mother of Dr. Ashutosh Kotwal, and translated by Jerry Pinto.

  • Published in September 2024 by HarperCollins India, the book narrates Kotwal’s journey from childhood to leading W boson research.
  • It was originally written in Marathi as Putra Vhava Aisa.
  • The book highlights his role in predicting the Higgs boson’s mass and leading the most-cited physics paper of 2022.
  • It’s a personal and scientific tribute, blending maternal insight with cutting-edge physics.

question: Who authored the book Mountain Mammals of the World, a comprehensive guide to high-altitude wildlife?
solution:
Mountain Mammals of the World is written by MK Ranjitsinh, a renowned conservationist and former IAS officer.

  • Published in August 2024 by Penguin Ebury Press, the book documents 58 species and 119 taxa of mountain mammals.
  • It includes maps, photographs, and insights into species like the snow leopard, mountain gorilla, and Asiatic black bear.
  • Ranjitsinh’s work is inspired by Buddhism, Kashmir, and his decades of field experience.
  • The foreword is by Dr. George Schaller, and the introduction by His Holiness the Dalai Lama.
